contentrichtext.text: {{Expand Farsi|نطنز|date=June 2012}} {{for|the administrative subdivision|Natanz County}} {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Natanz |native_name = نطنز |settlement_type = city |image_skyline = Tomb_of_Sheikh_Abdolsamad,_Natanz.jpg |imagesize = 260px |image_caption = Tomb of [[Abdas-Samad Esfahani|Abd al_Samad]], built in 1304. |pushpin_map = Iran |mapsize = 150px |coordinates_region = IR |subdivision_type = [[List of countries|Country]] |subdivision_name = {{flag|Iran}} |subdivision_type1 = [[Provinces of Iran|Province]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Isfahan Province|Isfahan]] |subdivision_type2 = [[Counties of Iran|County]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Natanz County|Natanz]] |subdivision_type3 = [[Bakhsh]] |subdivision_name3 = [[Central District (Natanz County)|Central]] |leader_title = |leader_name = |established_title = |established_date = |area_total_km2 = |area_footnotes = |population_as_of = 2006 |population_total = 12060 |population_density_km2 = auto |timezone = [[Iran Standard Time|IRST]] |utc_offset = +3:30 |timezone_DST = [[Iran Daylight Time|IRDT]] |utc_offset_DST = +4:30 |coordinates_display = % |latd=33|latm=30|lats=48|latNS=N |longd=51|longm=54|longs=59|longEW=E |elevation_m = |website = |area_code = |footnotes = }} '''Natanz''' ({{lang-fa|نطنز}}, also [[Romanize]]d as '''Naţanz''')<ref>{{GEOnet3|-3076691}}</ref> is a city in and the capital of [[Natanz County]], [[Isfahan Province]], [[Iran]]. At the 2006 census, its population was 12,060, in 3,411 families.<ref>{{IranCensus2006|10}}</ref> It is located {{convert|70|km|mi}} south-east of [[Kashan]]. Its bracing climate and locally-produced fruit{{fact|date=June 2013}} are well known in [[Iran]].{{fact|date=June 2013}} Its pear fruits are well known.<ref name=Bamford2>[[James Bamford|Bamford, James]]. "The Secret War." ''[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]''. June 12, 2013. "[http://www.wired.com/threatlevel/2013/06/general-keith-alexander-cyberwar/2/ 2]. Retrieved on June 14, 2013.</ref> The famous [[Karkas mountain chain]] (Kuh-e Karkas) (meaning ''mountain of [[vultures]]''), at an elevation of 3,899 meters, rises above the town, and locals point in its direction telling how the [[Achaemenid dynasty|Achaemenian]] King, [[Darius III]], was killed nearby.<ref>The place where [[Darius III]] was murdered by his relative, the [[satrap]] [[Bessus]], is believed by historians to lie in the region of [[Ahevanu]] in [[Semnan province]], much more to the east and north than Natanz.</ref> Various small [[shrine]]s dot the area,{{fact|date=June 2013}} and it is known as the shrine of [[Abdas-Samad Esfahani|Abd as-Samad]].<ref name=Bamford2/> The elements in the present complex date from 1304 with subsequent additions and restorations, such as the [[Khaneqah]] and [[Muqarnas|Muqarnas vault]]. The tomb honors the [[Sufi]] ''Sheikh Abd al-Samad'', and was built by the Sheikh's disciple, the [[Ilkhanid]] [[vizier]] ''Zain al-Din Mastari''. ==Nuclear facility== [[File:Natanz nuclear.jpg|left|thumb|Anti-aircraft guns guarding Natanz Nuclear Facility]] The Natanz Nuclear Facility, located some 30 km NNW from the town ({{coord|33|43|N|51|43|E}}) near a major highway, is generally recognized as Iran's central facility for enrichment with over 5000 centrifuges currently operational and being fed with [[uranium hexafluoride]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iaea.org/Publications/Documents/Board/2008/gov2008-38.pdf |title=Implementation of the NPT Safeguards Agreement and relevant provisions of Security Council Resolutions 1737 (2006), 1747 (2007) and 1803 (2008) in the Islamic Republic of Iran, September 15, 2008 |format=PDF |date= |accessdate=2012-06-19}}</ref> == See also == {{Portal|Iran}} * [[Nuclear facilities in Iran]] ==References== {{Commonscat}} {{reflist}} [http://natanznews.ir natanznews] == External links == * [http://www.isis-online.org/publications/iran/natanz03_02.html Institute for Science and International Security] * [http://tehran.stanford.edu/imagemap/natanz.html Stanford University entry on Natanz] * [http://www.globalsecurity.org/wmd/world/iran/natanz.htm www.globalsecurity.org entry on Natanz] * [http://islamicarts.blogspot.com/2006/01/shrine-complex-of-shaykh-abd-al-samad.html Shrine Complex of Shaykh 'Abd al-Samad] * [http://www.persiancarpetguide.com/sw-asia/Rugs/Persian/Natanz_Rugs/Sheikh_Abdolsamad_Mosque_Natanz.htm The Sheikh Abdolsamad Mosque in Natanz Iran] {{Isfahan Province}} [[Category:Natanz County]] [[Category:Cities in Iran]] [[Category:Cities in Isfahan Province]]
